metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3558 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component of OracleVirtualization (subcomponent: Core). Supported versions that are affectedare Prior to 5.0.38 and Prior to 5.1.20. Easily "exploitable" vulnerabilityallows unauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure whereOracle VM VirtualBox executes to compromise Oracle VM VirtualBox. While thevulnerability is in Oracle VM VirtualBox, attacks may significantly impactadditional products. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash(complete DOS) of Oracle VM VirtualBox as well as unauthorized update,insert or delete access to some of Oracle VM VirtualBox accessible data andunauthorized read access to a subset of Oracle VM VirtualBox accessibledata. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 8.5 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-dkms - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-qt - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
virtualbox-source - 5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.38-dfsg-0ubuntu1.16.04.1').
